title.narrative: Rapid response to nutritional crises in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC)

description.narrative: The project is part of the mechanism for rapid response to nutritional emergencies in the DRC. Drawing on their many years of experience, Action Against Hunger (ACF) and Cooperazione Internationale (COOPI) will endeavor to respond to nutritional emergencies in the different health zones of the DRC, identified by the national warning system, other sources of information (provincial and national clusters, alerts provided by other INGOs) and confirmed with nutrition and mortality surveys, through a multisectoral approach. The interventions will take place in health zones (ZoS) with a global acute malnutrition (GAM) rate of 15% or more and / or severe acute malnutrition (SAM) rates of 5% or more. Each intervention will include, in particular, the management of SAM in six zones, capacity building of staff in this area, promotion of Nutrition and Young Children (IYCF) practices, hygiene and sanitation And the integration of a Water Hygiene Sanitation component within the framework of the Wash in Nutrition (WiN) strategy. The project aims to contribute to the reduction of mortality and morbidity linked to SAM.
